name: sew
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 [ I or T ] to join two pieces of cloth together by putting thread through them with a needle: My grandmother taught me to sew. I made this skirt just by sewing two pieces of material together. He sewed the badge neatly onto his uniform.
B1 [ T ] to make a piece of clothing by joining pieces of cloth together by putting thread through them with a needle: She sews all her children's clothes.
[ I or T ] to use a needle and thread to join up the edges of a cut in the skin or other part of the body: The muscle layer needs to be sewn first. His finger was cut off when he caught it in a machine, but the surgeon was able to sew it back on.
